DOC.brief_summary: All neuropathic chronicle pains are difficult to treat. Currently many patients are not relieved by electric stimulations of central nervous system, existing. Recently cortical stimulation had a development important and benefit effects are proven. In this study we evaluate medico-economic impact of this treatment.
DOC.brief_title: Economic Medical Evaluation of Treatment of the Neuropathic Pain Rebel by Cortical Stimulation
DOC.criteria: Presence of pain caused by lesion of central or peripheral nervous system Pain persistent since one year at least Pain untreated with 3 different antalgic treatments Exclusion Criteria Pain linked t a malignant affection patient < 18 yearsold
